p: GC-Olfactometry sensory assessments were performed for all compounds with a panel of 9 females panelists aged 21–32 years. They had extensive training and more than three years' experience in GC/O using the method described previously [ 35, 36, 39]. The samples were served in a random order to each panelist. Each panelist selected the most appropriate terms for odor description, as reported by Shimoda et al. [ 40, 41]. A consensus-building discussion was held with the panelists to decide the final sensory descriptors, summarized in Table 1.
